name: Active Recreation Area Opens at Waterfront Park
description: The new active recreation area opened today in the northeast corner of Waterfront Park.

affiliation.name: County of San Diego Communications Office

articleContent:
Reading Time:  < 1 minuteSan Diegans now have more ways to go outside and get active at Waterfront Park. 
The new active recreation area opened today in the northeast corner of Waterfront Park. 
The new facilities include: 

A basketball court 
Two pickleball courts 
A five-station fitness apparatus 
Table tennis 
A fenced off-leash dog area with agility equipment 
Benches 
Drinking fountains 

The active recreation area will be open daily from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. 
Equipment check-out will be open from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. during summer hours and from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. from fall to spring. 
The new amenities were built with equity as a priority. The equipment and features are free to use, encouraging an active lifestyle for everyone, including those who may not be able to afford a gym membership or local sports program. 
Drought-tolerant trees and plants line the perimeter of the 1.25-acre recreation area to add ambiance, support environmental sustainability measures, and buffer sound from sports activities.
The County’s Department of Parks and Recreation and Board of Supervisors Vice Chair Terra Lawson-Remer held a ribbon-cutting ceremony to celebrate the opening. Organizers of the event also hosted an interactive pickleball workshop after the ceremony. 
For more information, visit sdparks.org.
